stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the session wrestling with Blender/Fast64 export problems, tries the new F64 renderer, imports a test Luigi model, lays out a volcano section of the overworld, and shows a new "return to overworld" dialog while reporting that Course 7 is in beta on real N64 hardware.

development_findings.summary: Course 7 is essentially finished and has been sent to external testers; it already runs correctly on real N64 hardware.
development_findings.quote: I finished most of course 7 and I set it out for a beta test. It fully works on real N64, which is amazing.

development_findings.summary: Current ROM image is 59.953 MB; the team intends to cap the final game at or below the 64 MB cartridge limit.
A new post-star dialog lets the player choose to stay in the level or exit to the overworld, addressing an awkward pause present in the demo builds.
development_findings.quote: Do you want to return to the overworld? Stay or leave?

development_findings.summary: The overworld is being prototyped in coarse segments but will be rebuilt as one dynamically loaded level so shared scenery (e.g., a large tree) is visible from multiple angles.
Kaze is modelling a mountainous, forest-covered volcano region that will house a train station and connect to other areas.
Side levels are intended to be bite-sized (built in 1–2 days each); one concept is an oil-tanker infiltration that leads into Oily Body Bay (Side Level 5).
development_findings.quote: There’s an oil tanker full of enemies that you have to infiltrate … entering the tanker warps you to Oily Body Bay.

development_findings.summary: A Luigi character model was imported; his final use is undecided, but co-op play is under consideration.
development_findings.quote: Co-op would be the coolest option.

development_findings.summary: Installing the F64 renderer add-on greatly reduced Blender 4.1’s crippling lag and offers N64-style decal emulation, though transparency handling is still inaccurate.
development_findings.quote: So far it's kind of goated … wait, maybe we have to take back the death threats. Maybe Lilaa was right.

development_findings.summary: Fast64’s global "write all" flag keeps re-enabling itself on file load, breaking exports (e.g., Mario’s hair disappearing). Kaze and Lilaa traced the issue to a missing dependency on the "bleed" setting.
development_findings.quote: The option that breaks if you don't have bleed activated turns itself on whenever you open the file.

development_findings.summary: Kaze fixed a compiler warning about identical branches; he is aiming for zero warnings in the final build.
PAL support is not yet addressed and will be handled after NTSC development is stable.
development_findings.quote: For me PAL right now is in the background. That will have to be an afterthought.

development_findings.summary: Kaze believes console performance will be "basically perfect FPS" after recent low-level optimisations (LVP vs. RDP).

context_findings.summary: Kaze prefers personalised ads and is unconcerned about telemetry, arguing it improves the viewing experience.
context_findings.quote: If I'm going to have to sit there and watch an ad, at least show me a product I might want to buy.

context_findings.summary: Upgraded to Windows 11 because Windows 10 security support is ending; finds 11 buggy but usable.
context_findings.quote: Although it is completely embarrassing and pathetic how buggy Windows 11 has been so far.

context_findings.summary: Mentioned recent weight loss and constant bug-bite itching; also owns a robotic lawnmower and jokes about selling feet pics for funding.
Streams generate little income; a single YouTube sponsor for F3 or a shift to more videos could fund the project and pay editors (~US$60–70k potential).
context_findings.quote: Streams don't make a lot of money. If I just made YouTube videos, I think I could pretty easily get like 60–70 thousand a year.

context_findings.summary: He will have two weeks off work in roughly a fortnight and plans daily streams to finish the overworld during that window.
Expresses scepticism toward most philosophy, mockingly calls Kant’s categorical imperative "delusional," and critiques politics-streamer incentives.
Questions why modern productivity hasn’t reduced human labour, arguing capitalism may misallocate technological gains.

biobak.summary: Kaze suggests Biobak install the F64 renderer so both can debug decal issues consistently.
biobak.quote: Damn, Biobak, maybe you should download this renderer too.

zeina.summary: Zeina briefly joins the chat; Kaze is UV-mapping when she arrives.

key_stories.title: Write-All Option Bug
key_stories.summary: An auto-resetting 'write all' checkbox in Fast64 kept corrupting exports, turning Mario’s hair white or removing it entirely. Kaze and Lilaa traced the behaviour to a hidden repository setting that conflicts with the 'bleed' flag.
key_stories.challenge: Models exported with missing textures and disappearing hair.
key_stories.process: Repeated tests showed 'write all' re-enabled every time the .blend reopened; discussed with Lilaa; located the offending JSON repo setting.
key_stories.outcome: Identified bug and temporary workaround; longer-term fix needed in Fast64.
key_stories.key_quote: The option that breaks if you don't have bleed activated turns itself on whenever you open the file.

key_stories.title: Installing F64 Renderer
key_stories.summary: Blender 4.1 became unusably slow (100 % CPU) during level editing. After resistance, Kaze installed the F64 renderer plug-in on Lilaa’s advice and performance immediately stabilised.
key_stories.challenge: Severe editor lag made modelling impossible.
key_stories.process: Tested older Blender versions, then downloaded and enabled the add-on.
key_stories.outcome: Editing became responsive; Kaze acknowledged the improvement though decal accuracy still needs work.
key_stories.key_quote: Wait, maybe we have to take back the death threats. Maybe Lilaa was right.

key_stories.title: Return-to-Overworld Dialog
key_stories.summary: Previous demos forced players to remain in a course after grabbing a star. Kaze added a simple yes/no prompt so players can exit instantly.
key_stories.process: Implemented new UI dialog and showed live demo.
key_stories.outcome: Feature works; improves pacing and testing efficiency.
key_stories.key_quote: If you hit stay, you stay. If you hit leave, it pops you out.

open_questions.context: Luigi model imported; Kaze unsure how it ties into gameplay.
questions: Will Luigi be a playable second character?
Is real-time co-op on N64 technically feasible?
What design challenges does adding Luigi introduce?

open_questions.context: Plan to merge overworld chunks into one dynamically loaded level.
questions: How will memory be managed for seamless streaming on original hardware?
What loading boundaries or LOD systems will be used?
Is this a proven workflow or an upcoming experiment?

open_questions.context: Side levels are expected to take 1–2 days each; over 100 tracks planned.
questions: Exactly how many side levels remain?
Who is responsible for level-design, graphics, and music on these?
Will their simplicity compromise overall polish?

open_questions.context: Transparency decals and depth quantisation differ from in-game visuals.
questions: What specific rendering errors still need fixing?
Who owns the renderer’s maintenance?
Will the tool be standardised across the art team soon?

open_questions.context: Kaze calls PAL an afterthought and hasn’t tested it.
questions: Will a PAL build ship at release?
What timing and frame-rate issues are anticipated?
Who will handle region-specific QA?
What systems are in place to monitor ROM growth?
What assets or features are most likely to be trimmed?
Any contingency if 64 MB is exceeded?

open_questions.context: Kaze suggests end-of-year completion ‘if I lose my job’.
questions: What official internal milestones exist?
How does full-time employment affect scheduling?
What is the fallback plan if scope slips into 2025?
